meanings.definition: Resembling or consisting of globs or blobs.
meanings.sent1: The paint had a globby texture, making it difficult to spread evenly.
meanings.sent2: The chef poured the globby batter onto the hot pan to make pancakes.
meanings.sent3: The globby slime oozed out of the container and onto the table, much to the kids' delight.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts were like a globby mess, all jumbled up and hard to untangle.
meanings.sent5: The globby mud clung to his shoes, weighing him down as he tried to walk through the field.

meanings.definition: Having a thick, sticky, or viscous consistency.
meanings.sent1: The glue dried into a globby mess on the paper.
meanings.sent2: The syrup was so globby that it stuck to the spoon when poured.
meanings.sent3: The globby honey dripped slowly from the jar, forming a sweet trail on the table.
meanings.sent4: Her voice sounded globby with emotion as she tried to hold back tears.
meanings.sent5: The globby substance clung stubbornly to the sides of the container, refusing to pour out easily.
